Package it.trvi.easyxml

Class XMLElement

java.lang.Object
it.trvi.easyxml.XMLElement
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class XMLElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
Class that represents an XML element with its text content, attributes and children. The tag name is immutable, all the other features can be modified.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    XMLElement​(java.lang.String tagName)
    Constructor for an XMLElement.

    Adds an XMLElement to the children of this XMLElement at the specific position in the list of children.

    Adds an XMLElement to the children of this XMLElement.

    • addAttribute

      public void addAttribute​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
      Adds to this XMLElement a new attribute by specifying its name and value. If an attribute with the same name already exists, it is replaced.
      Parameters:
      name - is the name of the attribute that must be added
      value - is the value of the attribute that must be added

    • getAttribute

      public java.lang.String getAttribute​(java.lang.String name) throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
      Returns the value of the attribute that has a specific name.
      Parameters:
      name - is the name of the attribute whose value must be returned
      Returns:
      the value of the attribute with that specific name
      Throws:
      java.util.NoSuchElementException - if this XMLElement has no attribute with that name

    • hasAttribute

      public boolean hasAttribute​(java.lang.String name)
      Returns true if this instance of XMLElement has a specific attribute.
      Parameters:
      name - is the name of the attribute
      Returns:
      true if this instance of XMLElement has an attribute named name, false otherwise

    • removeAttributeByName

      public java.lang.String removeAttributeByName​(java.lang.String name)
      Removes a specific attribute from this XMLElement and returns the value of that attribute. If that attribute does not exist, it returns null.
      Parameters:
      name - is the name of the attribute that must be removed
      Returns:
      the value of the attribute that is removed, null if the attribute was not present

    • addChild

      public void addChild​(XMLElement child) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Adds an XMLElement to the children of this XMLElement.
      Parameters:
      child - is the XMLElement that must be added to the children of this XMLElement
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if child is an ancestor of this XMLElement or if this and child are the same object

    • addChild

      public void addChild​(int i, XMLElement child) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Adds an XMLElement to the children of this XMLElement at the specific position in the list of children. Shifts the child currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent children to the right (adds one to their indices).
      Parameters:
      i - is the index at which the new child will be located
      child - is the XMLElement that must be added to the children of this XMLElement
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if child is an ancestor of this XMLElement or if this and child are the same object

    • removeChild

      public void removeChild​(XMLElement child) throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
      Removes an XMLElement from the children of this XMLElement. Only the direct children are removed, not the other descendants.
      Parameters:
      child - is the children that must be removed
      Throws:
      java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the specified element is not a child of this XMLElement.

    • removeChild

      public void removeChild​(int i)
      Removes the child at the specified position from the list of children of this XMLElement.
      Parameters:
      i - is the index of the child that must be removed from the list of children of this XMLElement

      Returns:
      the ith child of this XMLElement

    • swapChildrenPosition

      public void swapChildrenPosition​(int i, int j)
      Swaps the positions of two children in the children list of this instance of XMLElement.
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the first child that must be swapped
      j - the index of the second child that must be swapped

    • moveChildPositionUp

      public void moveChildPositionUp​(int i, int n)
      Moves a child in the children list of this instance of XMLElement "up" (that is, towards the beginning of the list) by a certain number of positions.
      Parameters:
      i - is the index of the child that must be moved
      n - is the number of positions that the child at i must be moved up

    • moveChildPositionDown

      public void moveChildPositionDown​(int i, int n)
      Moves a child in the children list of this instance of XMLElement "down" (that is, towards the end of the list) by a certain number of positions.
      Parameters:
      i - is the index of the child that must be moved
      n - is the number of positions that the child at i must be moved down

    • getDescendantsWithTag

      public java.util.ArrayList<XMLElement> getDescendantsWithTag​(java.lang.String tagName)
      Returns all the descendants of this XMLElement that have a specific tag name.
      Parameters:
      tagName - is tag name of the descendants that must be returned
      Returns:
      an ArrayList<XMLElement> containing all the descendants of this XMLElement whose tag name is tagName.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the string representation of this XMLElement.
